page.title: 12Bird Life. (Romney Marsh).
page.content: Rooks and Jackdaws, Lapwings tumbling in the sky. Herring Gulls and Black Heads returning from the foreshore. Swans on the canal. With a flash of blue....a Kingfisher. The intense yellow of a Yellow Wagtail, the melancholy note of a Curlew as it flies high overhead. A Heron reluctantly rising from a dyke to return to its heronry at West Hythe. The warblers in the summer - Reed and Sedge, Chiff-Chaff and Willow. Swallows and Martins - how few there have been this year, 1985. What ducks are those? Mallard or Teal. Perhaps the walk will be rewarded with a sight of a Green Sandpiper, Redshank, Snipe or Rail. Not to mention many others in this interesting and varied area with its marsh, woods, fields, canal and even a Wild Life Sanctuary.
